001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont.BitmapFontData;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFontCache;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.GlyphLayout;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer.ShapeType;
011import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
012import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor;
013import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Align;
014import squidpony.panel.IColoredString;
015import squidpony.panel.IMarkup;
016
017import java.util.ArrayDeque;
018import java.util.ArrayList;
019import java.util.Iterator;
020
021/**
022 * An actor capable of drawing {@link IColoredString}s. It is lines-oriented:
023 * putting a line may erase a line put before. It is designed to write text with
024 * a variable-width font (as opposed to {@link SquidPanel}). It performs line wrapping by
025 * default. It can write from top to bottom or from bottom to top (the default).
026 * 
027 * <p>
028 * This
029 * <a href="https://twitter.com/hgamesdev/status/736091292132724736">tweet</a>
030 * shows an example. The panel at the top of the screenshot is implemented using
031 * this class (with {@link #drawBottomUp} being {@code true}).
032 * </p>
033 * 
034 * <p>
035 * This class is usually used as follows:
036 * 
037 * <pre>
038 * final int nbLines = LinesPanel.computeMaxLines(font, pixelHeight);
039 * final LinesPanel<Color> lp = new LinesPanel(new GDXMarkup(), font, nbLines);
040 * lp.setSize(pixelWidth, pixelHeight);
041 * stage.addActor(lp);
042 * </pre>
043 * </p>
044 * 
045 * <p>
046 * Contrary to {@link SquidMessageBox}, this panel doesn't support scrolling
047 * (for now). So it's suited when it is fine forgetting old messages (as in
048 * brogue's messages area).
049 * </p>
050 * 
051 * @author smelC
052 * @param <T>
053 * 
054 * @see SquidMessageBox An alternative, doing similar lines-drawing business,
055 *      but being backed up by {@link SquidPanel}.
056 */
057public class LinesPanel<T extends Color> extends Actor {
058
059        /** The markup used to typeset {@link #content}. */
060        protected final IMarkup<T> markup;
061
062        /** The font used to draw {@link #content}. */
063        protected final BitmapFont font;
064
065        /** An alternative to {@link #font}, used to draw {@link #content}. */
066        protected final TextCellFactory tcf;
067
068        /** What to display. Doesn't contain {@code null} entries. */
069        protected final ArrayDeque<IColoredString<T>> content;
070
071        /** The maximal size of {@link #content} */
072        protected final int maxLines;
073
074        /**
075         * The renderer used by {@link #clearArea(Batch)}. Do not access directly:
076         * use {@link #getRenderer()} instead.
077         */
078        protected /* @Nullable */ ShapeRenderer renderer;
079
080        /**
081         * The horizontal offset to use when writing. If you aren't doing anything
082         * weird, should be left to {@code 0}.
083         */
084        public float xOffset = 0;
085
086        /**
087         * The vertical offset to use when writing. If you aren't doing anything
088         * weird, should be left to {@code 0}.
089         */
090        public float yOffset = 0;
091
092        /**
093         * If {@code true}, draws:
094         * 
095         * <pre>
096         * ...
097         * content[1]
098         * content[0]
099         * </pre>
100         * 
101         * If {@code false}, draws:
102         * 
103         * <pre>
104         * content[0]
105         * content[1]
106         * ...
107         * </pre>
108         */
109        public boolean drawBottomUp = false;
110
111        /**
112         * The color to use to clear the screen before drawing. Set it to
113         * {@code null} if you clean on your own.
114         */
115        public Color clearingColor = Color.BLACK;
116
117        /* Now comes the usual libgdx options */
118
119        /** Whether to wrap text */
120        public boolean wrap = true;
121
122        /** The alignment used when typesetting */
123        public int align = Align.left;
124
125        /**
126         * @param markup
127         *            The markup to use, or {@code null} if none. You likely want to
128         *            give {@link GDXMarkup}. If non-{@code null}, markup will be
129         *            enabled in {@code font}.
130         * @param font
131         *            The font to use.
132         * @param maxLines
133         *            The maximum number of lines that this panel should display.
134         *            Must be {@code >= 0}.
135         * @throws IllegalStateException
136         *             If {@code maxLines < 0}
137         */
138        public LinesPanel(/* @Nullable */ IMarkup<T> markup, BitmapFont font, int maxLines) {
139                this.markup = markup;
140                this.font = font;
141                this.tcf = null;
142                if (maxLines < 0)
143                        throw new IllegalStateException("The maximum number of lines in an instance of "
144                                        + getClass().getSimpleName() + " must be greater or equal than zero");
145                this.maxLines = maxLines;
146                this.content = new ArrayDeque<>(maxLines);
147        }
148        /**
149         * @param markup
150         *            The markup to use, or {@code null} if none. You likely want to
151         *            give {@link GDXMarkup}. If non-{@code null}, markup will be
152         *            enabled in {@code font}.
153         * @param font
154         *            The font to use as a TextCellFactory, typically for distance field fonts.
155         * @param maxLines
156         *            The maximum number of lines that this panel should display.
157         *            Must be {@code >= 0}.
158         * @throws IllegalStateException
159         *             If {@code maxLines < 0}
160         */
161
162        public LinesPanel(/* @Nullable */ IMarkup<T> markup, TextCellFactory font, int maxLines) {
163                this.markup = markup;
164                this.tcf = font;
165                this.font = font.bmpFont;
166                if (maxLines < 0)
167                        throw new IllegalStateException("The maximum number of lines in an instance of "
168                                        + "LinesPanel must be greater or equal than zero");
169                this.maxLines = maxLines;
170                this.content = new ArrayDeque<>(maxLines);
171        }
172
173        /**
174         * Used to help find the last parameter to give the constructor of this class.
175         * @param font the font being used
176         * @param height the height of the area you want to put text into
177         * @return The last argument to give to
178         *         {@link #LinesPanel(IMarkup, BitmapFont, int)} when the
179         *         desired <b>pixel</b> height is {@code height}
180         */
181        public static int computeMaxLines(BitmapFont font, float height) {
182                return MathUtils.ceil(height / font.getData().lineHeight);
183        }
184
185        /**
186         * Used to help find the last parameter to give the constructor of this class.
187         * @param tcf the TextCellFactory being used
188         * @param height the height of the area you want to put text into
189         * @return The last argument to give to
190         *         {@link #LinesPanel(IMarkup, BitmapFont, int)} when the
191         *         desired <b>pixel</b> height is {@code height}
192         */
193        public static int computeMaxLines(TextCellFactory tcf, float height) {
194                return MathUtils.ceil(height / tcf.lineHeight);
195        }
196
197        /**
198         * Adds {@code ics} first in {@code this}, possibly removing the last entry,
199         * if {@code this}' size would grow over {@link #maxLines}.
200         *
201         * @param ics an IColoredString of the same color type as this LinesPanel; must be non-null
202         */
203        public void addFirst(IColoredString<T> ics) {
204                if (ics == null)
205                        throw new NullPointerException("Adding a null entry is forbidden");
206                if (atMax())
207                        content.removeLast();
208                content.addFirst(ics);
209        }
210
211        /**
212         * Adds {@code ics} last in {@code this}, possibly removing the first entry,
213         * if {@code this}' size would grow over {@link #maxLines}.
214         *
215         * @param ics an IColoredString of the same color type as this LinesPanel; must be non-null
216         */
217        public void addLast(IColoredString<T> ics) {
218                if (ics == null)
219                        throw new NullPointerException("Adding a null entry is forbidden");
220                if (atMax())
221                        content.removeFirst();
222                content.addLast(ics);
223        }
224
225        /**
226         * Change the first entry in {@code this} to  {@code ics}, overwriting the existing
227         * first entry if present.
228         * @param ics an IColoredString of the same color type as this LinesPanel; must be non-null
229         */
230        public void setFirst(IColoredString<T> ics)
231        {
232                if (ics == null)
233                        throw new NullPointerException("Adding a null entry is forbidden");
234                if(!content.isEmpty())
235                        content.removeFirst();
236                content.addFirst(ics);
237        }
238
239        /**
240         * Change the last entry in {@code this} to  {@code ics}, overwriting the existing
241         * last entry if present.
242         * @param ics an IColoredString of the same color type as this LinesPanel; must be non-null
243         */
244        public void setLast(IColoredString<T> ics)
245        {
246                if (ics == null)
247                        throw new NullPointerException("Adding a null entry is forbidden");
248                if(!content.isEmpty())
249                        content.removeLast();
250                content.addLast(ics);
251        }
252
253        /**
254         * Draws this LinesPanel using the given Batch.
255         * <br>
256         * This will set the shader of {@code batch} if using a distance field or MSDF font and the shader is currently not
257         * configured for such a font; it does not reset the shader to the default so that multiple Actors can all use the
258         * same shader and so specific extra glyphs or other items can be rendered after calling draw(). If you need to draw
259         * both a distance field font and full-color art, you should set the shader on the Batch to null when you want to
260         * draw full-color art, and end the Batch between drawing this object and the other art.
261         *
262         * @param batch a Batch such as a {@link FilterBatch} that must be between a begin() and end() call; usually done by Stage
263         * @param parentAlpha currently ignored
264         */
265        @Override
266        public void draw(Batch batch, float parentAlpha) {
267                clearArea(batch);
268
269                final float width = getWidth();
270                if(tcf != null)
271                        tcf.configureShader(batch);
272
273                final BitmapFontData data = font.getData();
274                final float lineHeight = data.lineHeight;
275                final float height = lineHeight * maxLines;
276
277                final float x = getX() + xOffset;
278                //TODO: check if drawBottomUp is correct or if lineHeight should be changed to 0
279                float y = getY() + (drawBottomUp ? lineHeight : height - lineHeight) - data.descent + yOffset;
280
281                final Iterator<IColoredString<T>> it = content.iterator();
282//              int ydx = 0;
283                float consumed = 0;
284                while (it.hasNext()) {
285                        final IColoredString<T> ics = it.next();
286                        //final String str = toDraw(ics, ydx);
287                        /* Let's see if the drawing would go outside this Actor */
288                        final BitmapFontCache cache = font.getCache();
289                        cache.clear();
290                        final GlyphLayout glyph = cache.setText(ics.present(), 0, 0, width, align, wrap);
291                        if (height < consumed + glyph.height)
292                                /* We would draw outside this Actor's bounds */
293                                break;
294                        final int nbLines = MathUtils.ceil(glyph.height / lineHeight);
295                        /* Actually draw */
296                        int ci = 0;
297                        ArrayList<IColoredString.Bucket<T>> frags = ics.getFragments();
298                        for (int i = 0; i < frags.size(); i++) {
299                                final IColoredString.Bucket<T> b = frags.get(i);
300                                cache.setColors(b.getColor(), ci, ci += b.length());
301                        }
302                        cache.setPosition(x, y);
303                        cache.draw(batch);
304                        y -= nbLines * lineHeight;
305                        consumed += nbLines * lineHeight;
306                        //ydx++;
307                }
308        }
309
310        /**
311         * Paints this panel with {@link #clearingColor}
312         */
313        protected void clearArea(Batch batch) {
314                if (clearingColor != null) {
315                        batch.end();
316                        UIUtil.drawRectangle(getRenderer(), getX(), getY(), getWidth(), getHeight(), ShapeType.Filled,
317                                        clearingColor);
318                        batch.begin();
319                }
320        }
321
322        protected boolean atMax() {
323                return content.size() == maxLines;
324
325        }
326        
327        /**
328         * If you want to grey out "older" messages, you would do it in this method,
329         * when {@code ydx > 0} (using an {@link squidpony.IColorCenter} maybe ?).
330         * 
331         * @param ics an IColoredString with the same generic color type as this LinesPanel
332         * @param ydx
333         *            The index of {@code ics} within {@link #content}.
334         * @return A variation of {@code ics}, or {@code ics} itself.
335         */
336        protected IColoredString<T> transform(IColoredString<T> ics, int ydx) {
337                return ics;
338        }
339
340        protected ShapeRenderer getRenderer() {
341                if (renderer == null)
342                        renderer = new ShapeRenderer();
343                return renderer;
344        }
345
346}
